thread.title: United States Senator Susan Collins to Visit Kaplan University Augusta, Maine
thread.title_full: United States Senator Susan Collins to Visit Kaplan University Augusta, Maine - Yahoo Finance

author: Kaplan University
title: United States Senator Susan Collins to Visit Kaplan University Augusta, Maine
text:
AUGUSTA, Maine--(BUSINESS WIRE)--
Kaplan University’s Augusta, Maine campus will host United States Senator Susan Collins (R-ME) on Saturday, October 3, at 11:30 a.m. Senator Collins is the keynote speaker for the first annual “Celebrating a Community That Cares” recognition awards ceremony for The Marketplace at Augusta being held at the University located at 14 Marketplace Drive in Augusta. 
The awards ceremony will honor volunteers and businesses for their commitment to the community. Kaplan University, which also has campuses in South Portland and Lewiston, is one of 19 award recipients including Boys & Girls Club, Maine Army National Guard and The Salvation Army. 
“Kaplan University is honored to welcome United States Senator Susan Collins to our campus in Augusta,” said Matthew Cote, Executive Director, Kaplan University Augusta campus. “Senator Collins’ visit and tour of our campus provides an opportunity for her to see firsthand the impact we are making in the lives of our students and the surrounding community each and every day.” 
Celebrating a Community That Cares acknowledges support for local community efforts. Each year educators, retailers, restaurants and entertainment facilities at The Marketplace at Augusta, raise over $200,000 for local charities and non-profits and donate endless amounts of time. The public is welcome to attend by making reservations at Kaplan University (207)213-2500. The recognition ceremony will be followed by a reception. 
About Kaplan University 
Kaplan University offers a different school of thought for higher education. It strives to help adult students unlock their talent by providing a practical, student-centered education that prepares them for careers in some of the fastest-growing industries. The University, which has its main campus in Davenport, Iowa, and its headquarters in Chicago, is accredited by The Higher Learning Commission . Kaplan University serves approximately 41,000 online and campus-based students. In addition to the three Maine campuses, Kaplan University has 11 campuses in Iowa, Indiana, Nebraska, Maryland, Missouri and Wisconsin, and a Kaplan University Learning Center in Maryland. 
Kaplan University is part of Kaplan Higher Education LLC and Kaplan, Inc., which serves over one million students globally each year through its array of higher education, test preparation, professional education, English-language training, university preparation, and K-12 offerings to individuals, institutions, and businesses. Kaplan has operations in over 30 countries, employs more than 19,000 full- and part-time professionals, and maintains relationships and partnerships with more than 1,000 school districts, colleges, and universities, and over 2,600 corporations and businesses. Kaplan is a subsidiary of Graham Holdings Company ( GHC ) and its largest division. For more information, please visit www.Kaplan.com .
